newsitem.title: CHINA: China rules out Western-style democracy.
newsitem.headline: China rules out Western-style democracy.

text.p: A top Beijing official said on Wednesday that China was practising "democracy with Chinese characteristics," and ruled out the Communist Party adopting a Western-style democratic system.

"We practise a multi-party cooperation and political consultation system, with the Communist Party of China (CPC) as the party in power," Qiao Shi, chairman of the National People's Congress, or parliament, said in an interview with a German newspaper.
China has eight tiny "democratic" parties, which pose no threat or challenge to the Communist Party and are more than eager to go along with the ruling party's policies.

"This system...is a system with Chinese characteristics, which is not like Western multi-party or two-party systems, nor like a one-party system," the official Xinhua news agency quoted Qiao as saying.
He said China was committed to improving its democratic system but added the Communist Party would forever remain loyal to Marxist principles.
"China's history and reality has determined that the CPC will never become a socialist democratic party," he said.
"A socialist democracy with Chinese characteristics is bound to be built up as long as unremitting efforts are made," Qiao said.

China's paramount leader Deng Xiaoping coined the phrase "socialism with Chinese characteristics" to justify the sweeping market reforms that he launched in the late 1970s, reversing Mao Zedong's egalitarian policies.
